problem.question: To make ice cubes freeze faster, you should:
options: Use hot water in the ice cube tray instead of cold water.
Use cold water in the ice cube tray instead of hot water.

key_steps: Mpemba effect: hot water can freeze faster than cold water under certain conditions
Hot water evaporates more, reducing volume to freeze
Hot water loses heat through convection more efficiently
Dissolved gases escape from hot water, affecting freezing dynamics

constraints.description: Mpemba effect is counterintuitive but real
Effect depends on container, volume, and freezer conditions

logic_requirements: Acknowledges counterintuitive nature of hot water freezing faster
Explains at least one mechanism (evaporation, convection, or dissolved gases)
